text: Fucaria mystax is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Skeneidae. ==Description== ==Distribution== This marine species occurs off hydrothermal vents of the Edison seamount at a depth of 1483 m.Crispin T. S. Little, Taniel Danelian, Richard J. Herrington, Rachel M. Haymon, Early Jurassic Hydrothermal Vent Community from the Franciscan Complex, California; Journal of Paleontology, Vol. 78, No. 3 (May, 2004), pp. 542-559 ==References== * Warén A. & Bouchet P. (2001). Gastropoda and Monoplacophora from hydrothermal vents and seeps new taxa and records. The Veliger 44(2): 116-231 mystax Category:Gastropods described in 2001
title: Fucaria mystax
